summary: This document appears to be a screenshot of a Twitter thread from August 2019. It shows user Jenni Hall discussing blocking an account and raising concerns about potential hacking or insider access at Twitter. The thread includes a reply from Christine Assange confirming her son Julian Assange is alive and warning about disinformation.

persons.name: Jenni Hall
persons.context: Twitter user who posted about blocking an account and expressing concerns that the blocked user remained visible, suggesting a possible hack or insider issue at Twitter.

persons.name: Christine Assange
persons.context: Replied to confirm her son Julian Assange is not dead and warned about unscrupulous operatives spreading false claims about his death to undermine efforts to free him.

persons.name: Julian Assange
persons.context: Subject of his mother's tweet confirming he is alive and not dead, amid global efforts to free him.

connections.description: Christine Assange is the mother of Julian Assange, as she confirms in her tweet.

events.title: Christine Assange confirms Julian Assange is alive
events.description: Christine Assange tweets to confirm her son Julian Assange is not dead and warns about operatives spreading false claims to undermine efforts to free him.

keyFacts: Christine Assange publicly confirmed on Twitter that her son Julian Assange was alive as of August 15, 2019.
Jenni Hall raised concerns about a Twitter account she blocked remaining visible, suggesting a potential hack or insider access at Twitter.
The tweet warns about 'unscrupulous operatives' possibly claiming Julian Assange is dead to undermine global efforts to free him.
